sentence: Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) will begin trading ex-dividend on January 18, 2018.
A cash dividend payment of $0.69 per share is scheduled to be paid on February 15, 2018.
Shareholders who purchased PG prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This marks the 4th quarter that PG has paid the same dividend.
The previous trading day's last sale of PG was $90.22, representing a -4.7% decrease from the 52 week high of $94.67 and a 7.56% increase over the 52 week low of $83.88.
PG is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Unilever NV ( UN ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
PG's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $5.69.
Zacks Investment Research reports PG's forecasted earnings growth in 2018 as 6.93%, compared to an industry average of 12.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the PG Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
